page.title: 05SCAMPTON SCHOOL
page.content: Scampton School is a Church of England School. It is an old victorian red brick school which was built at the end of the 19th century. At first there was only one classroom but then the school was enlarged. Fifty years ago Miss Ascott tought 8-14 year old pupils. She was very strict and used the cane and the leather strap. The vicar's daughter taught the infants who used slates while the older ones used pen and ink. There were about 50 pupils most of whom did not go to secondary school. There was no school bus or cars, so children had to walk to school in all weathers. Most children went to Sunday School as well as evening service.
